intro: Manihot brasiliana, commonly known as the Brazilian arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and succulent leaves. The plant produces edible tubers that are rich in starch and have a mild, sweet flavor. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value and edible parts, it is cultivated in gardens and for agricultural purposes.
